terms.definition: A software system that provides tools for creating, organizing, storing, and maintaining technical documentation and knowledge resources.
User Interface - the visual elements and interactive components through which users interact with a software application or website.
Cascading Style Sheets - a programming language used to describe the presentation and styling of web pages and user interfaces.
An authentication method that allows users to access multiple applications or systems with one set of login credentials.
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to see revision history and revert to previous versions.
A single, unified location where all documents, files, or data are stored and managed, providing easy access and organization.
The process of organizing, storing, and maintaining digital content such as documents, images, and multimedia files in a systematic way.
The capability of software to display content and interface elements in multiple languages for international users.
The process of converting readable data into coded format to protect sensitive information from unauthorized access during storage or transmission.
Security measures that determine which users can view, edit, or manage specific documents or system features based on their permissions.
Data analysis tools that track how users interact with documentation, showing metrics like page views, search queries, and user behavior patterns.
The process of adapting content and software interfaces to meet the language, cultural, and regulatory requirements of specific regions or countries.
Interactive mechanisms that allow users to provide comments, suggestions, or ratings on documentation to facilitate continuous improvement.
The ability to modify the appearance, layout, and branding elements of a documentation platform to match organizational identity and requirements.
A feature that allows users to mark and reference specific time points within video content for easy navigation and information retrieval.
